import pandas as pd

# Define a class to represent a simple music chart
class MusicChart:
    def __init__(self):
        # Initialize the chart with an empty DataFrame
        self.chart = pd.DataFrame(columns=['Artist', 'Song', 'Popularity'])

    def add_song(self, artist, song, popularity):
        # Add a new song to the chart
        new_entry = {'Artist': artist, 'Song': song, 'Popularity': popularity}
        self.chart = self.chart.append(new_entry, ignore_index=True)

    def pop_song(self):
        # Remove the least popular song from the chart
        min_popularity_index = self.chart['Popularity'].idxmin()
        self.chart.drop(min_popularity_index, inplace=True)

    def get_top_songs(self, top_n):
        # Get the top N songs from the chart
        return self.chart.nlargest(top_n, 'Popularity')

# Create a new music chart
my_chart = MusicChart()

# Add some songs to the chart
my_chart.add_song('Artist A', 'Song A', 90)
my_chart.add_song('Artist B', 'Song B', 95)
my_chart.add_song('Artist C', 'Song C', 85)

# Pop the least popular song
my_chart.pop_song()

# Get the top 2 songs
print(my_chart.get_top_songs(2))
